intro: Asphodelus mariolousae, commonly known as the Mediterranean asphodel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces tall, slender stems with narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. The species is often found in Mediterranean scrublands and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance and ornamental value.
